page.title: 11COWLEY AND BROWN'S CHARITY
page.content: In 1725 Thomas Cowley made a bequest that rents from certain lands should be used to endow Quadring School and for the assistance of needy and infirm persons. One of the people entrusted to see to this was one Edward Brown. He too left land to be used in a similar manner. This money is now looked after by a group of local people known as the Trustees. Each year they provide money for Christmas boxes for pensioners.Money is also made available to people who are receiving education and need to purchase books etc. Quadring Cowley and Brown's Primary School regularly receives help from this charity.
